title: Citi Uruguay Helps Inaugurate Liceo Providencia
summary: Montevideo - Citi Uruguay representatives participated in the inauguration of Liceo Providencia, a private junior high school in the Casabó district of Montevideo, alongside officials from the school, representatives of the Ministry of Education and Culture, the U.S. Ambassador, executives from participating companies, students and teachers.
tag-1: Citi Uruguay Helps Inaugurate Liceo Providencia
tag-2: Montevideo – Citi Uruguay representatives participated in the inauguration of Liceo Providencia, a private junior high school in the Casabó district of Montevideo, alongside officials from the school, representatives of the Ministry of Education and Culture, the U.S. Ambassador, executives from participating companies, students and teachers.
tag-3: Citi has supported Centro Educativo Providencia, which works with children and teens through the age of 18, for several years.
tag-4: One of the pillars of Citi's corporate social responsibility program is education to prepare at-risk young people for the job market, a mission consistent with Providencia's goal to create "a tuition-free middle school whose educational, family and community philosophy contributes to create equitable educational and job opportunities in this country."
tag-5: "Our collaboration with Centro Providencia and, now, Liceo Providencia is part of our social investment policy and our conviction that the best way to support society is by improving educational and social insertion opportunities for young people and providing them with the tools for leveraging their future," Citi Uruguay Country Officer Daniel Varese commented at the inauguration.
tag-6: Gabriel González, Citi Uruguay Treasurer and one of the main backers of the collaboration with Providencia, added: "It's very satisfying to see the implementation of this new stage in a project that is dear to our hearts and in which we have collaborated for many years, not only through funding but also with volunteer work."
tag-7: The President of Asociación Civil Providencia, Diego Bonomi, thanked all of the companies who collaborated in financing the new educational initiative.
tag-8: Liceo Providencia is opening its doors with 60 first-year junior high students. The goal is to reach 2016 with 180 students in three grade levels.

tag-11: Providencia Centro Educativo Providencia was founded 18 years ago in Casabó as a volunteer-run food bank for children. Over time it split into two functions: a Kids' Club offering classes and tutoring to more than 100 neighborhood children, and a Youth Center serving 90 high school and UTU students.
